body:
A bit of context on this: I pinpointed the commit that introduced this behaviour after a few round of `git bisect` Please find the commit here - https://github.com/rclone/rclone/pull/5323/commits/09d63d7956e18baa4b7ed734feaa9ad4d5e24e69 . I left a comment in the original PR https://github.com/rclone/rclone/pull/5323#discussion_r1206718317 . @ncw suggested I should open an issue for better visibility.

If there is anything I can do to help resolve this problem, please let me know. Thanks!

> Getting the following error with `rclond lsd -R` on the GCS bucket with directory markers

Are you using `directory_markers = true` in the config file? I'm guessing not.

I can't seem to reproduce this.

The problem appears to be that rclone isn't recognising the directory marker.

In the GCS backend a directory marker needs to end in `/` .

Can you do 

    rclone lsd gcs://bucket-name/dir_name -R -vv --dump bodies

And attach the result? I'm looking to see exactly how your directory markers are made.

Or is there a way I can make a reproducer here?

Here is what they look like when rclone makes them (JSON prettified)

```json
    {
      "kind": "storage#object",
      "id": "rclone-dirmarkers/foo//1685717152364333",
      "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/storage/v1/b/rclone-dirmarkers/o/foo%2F",
      "mediaLink": "https://storage.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/rclone-dirmarkers/o/foo%2F?generation=1685717152364333&alt=media",
      "name": "foo/",
      "bucket": "rclone-dirmarkers",
      "generation": "1685717152364333",
      "metageneration": "1",
      "contentType": "application/octet-stream",
      "storageClass": "STANDARD",
      "size": "0",
      "md5Hash": "1B2M2Y8AsgTpgAmY7PhCfg==",
      "crc32c": "AAAAAA==",
      "etag": "CK3uu+DppP8CEAE=",
      "timeCreated": "2023-06-02T14:45:52.366Z",
      "updated": "2023-06-02T14:45:52.366Z",
      "timeStorageClassUpdated": "2023-06-02T14:45:52.366Z",
      "metadata": {
        "goog-reserved-file-mtime": "1685717152",
        "mtime": "2023-06-02T15:45:52.040018183+01:00"
      }
    },
```

> Are you using directory_markers = true in the config file? I'm guessing not.

Yes I'm using `directoy_markers = true`.

Please use this script to set up the directory markers for issue reproduction:

```bash
#!/bin/bash

BUCKET_URL=gcs://rclone-dir-marker-test

mkdir -p a/b/c
mkdir -p  b/c/d

rclone sync -vv --create-empty-src-dirs --gcs-directory-markers . $BUCKET_URL/test
```

#### First run:
```
$ ./setup.sh
2023/06/03 22:59:47 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.63.0-beta.7054.51a468b2b" starting with parameters ["rclone" "sync" "-vv" "--create-empty-src-dirs" "--gcs-directory-markers" "." "gcs://rclone-dir-marker-test/test"]
2023/06/03 22:59:47 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "."
2023/06/03 22:59:47 DEBUG : Using config file from "/Users/joe.cai/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2023/06/03 22:59:47 DEBUG : fs cache: renaming cache item "." to be canonical "/Users/joe.cai/tmp/gcs-directory-marker-test"
2023/06/03 22:59:47 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "gcs://rclone-dir-marker-test/test"
2023/06/03 22:59:47 DEBUG : gcs: detected overridden config - adding "{juk_h}" suffix to name
2023/06/03 22:59:47 DEBUG : fs cache: renaming cache item "gcs://rclone-dir-marker-test/test" to be canonical "gcs,directory_markers='true':rclone-dir-marker-test/test"
2023/06/03 22:59:48 DEBUG : setup.sh: Need to transfer - File not found at Destination
2023/06/03 22:59:48 DEBUG : GCS bucket rclone-dir-marker-test path test: Waiting for checks to finish
2023/06/03 22:59:48 DEBUG : GCS bucket rclone-dir-marker-test path test: Waiting for transfers to finish
2023/06/03 22:59:49 DEBUG : /: Creating directory marker
2023/06/03 22:59:50 DEBUG : setup.sh: md5 = d6035e8d7a110b61993d2cc39c17fbd6 OK
2023/06/03 22:59:50 INFO  : setup.sh: Copied (new)
2023/06/03 22:59:50 DEBUG : a/b/c: Making directory
2023/06/03 22:59:50 DEBUG : a/b/c/: Creating directory marker
2023/06/03 22:59:51 DEBUG : a/b/: Creating directory marker
2023/06/03 22:59:51 DEBUG : a/: Creating directory marker
2023/06/03 22:59:52 DEBUG : b/c/d: Making directory
2023/06/03 22:59:52 DEBUG : b/c/d/: Creating directory marker
2023/06/03 22:59:53 DEBUG : b/c/: Creating directory marker
2023/06/03 22:59:54 DEBUG : b/: Creating directory marker
2023/06/03 22:59:54 DEBUG : GCS bucket rclone-dir-marker-test path test: copied 2 directories
2023/06/03 22:59:54 DEBUG : Waiting for deletions to finish
2023/06/03 22:59:54 INFO  :
Transferred:   	        170 B / 170 B, 100%, 28 B/s, ETA 0s
Transferred:            1 / 1, 100%
Elapsed time:         7.6s

2023/06/03 22:59:54 DEBUG : 7 go routines active
```

The created directory markers appear to be normal directory markers
```
$ gsutil stat gs://rclone-dir-marker-test/test/a/b/c/
gs://rclone-dir-marker-test/test/a/b/c/:
    Creation time:          Sat, 03 Jun 2023 12:59:50 GMT
    Update time:            Sat, 03 Jun 2023 12:59:50 GMT
    Storage class:          STANDARD
    Content-Length:         0
    Content-Type:           application/octet-stream
    Metadata:
        goog-reserved-file-mtime:1685797190
        mtime:              2023-06-03T22:59:50.031158+10:00
    Hash (crc32c):          AAAAAA==
    Hash (md5):             1B2M2Y8AsgTpgAmY7PhCfg==
    ETag:                   CI/51/WTp/8CEAE=
    Generation:             1685797190630543
    Metageneration:         1
```

#### Second run

rclone sync will start to log the errors:
```
$ ./setup.sh
2023/06/03 22:58:09 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.63.0-beta.7054.51a468b2b" starting with parameters ["rclone" "sync" "-vv" "--create-empty-src-dirs" "--gcs-directory-markers" "." "gcs://rclone-dir-marker-test/test"]
2023/06/03 22:58:09 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "."
2023/06/03 22:58:09 DEBUG : Using config file from "/Users/joe.cai/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2023/06/03 22:58:09 DEBUG : fs cache: renaming cache item "." to be canonical "/Users/joe.cai/tmp/gcs-directory-marker-test"
2023/06/03 22:58:09 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "gcs://rclone-dir-marker-test/test"
2023/06/03 22:58:09 DEBUG : gcs: detected overridden config - adding "{juk_h}" suffix to name
2023/06/03 22:58:10 DEBUG : fs cache: renaming cache item "gcs://rclone-dir-marker-test/test" to be canonical "gcs,directory_markers='true':rclone-dir-marker-test/test"
2023/06/03 22:58:10 ERROR : : Entry doesn't belong in directory "" (same as directory) - ignoring
2023/06/03 22:58:10 DEBUG : setup.sh: Size and modification time the same (differ by 0s, within tolerance 1ns)
2023/06/03 22:58:10 DEBUG : setup.sh: Unchanged skipping
2023/06/03 22:58:10 ERROR : d: Entry doesn't belong in directory "d" (too short) - ignoring
2023/06/03 22:58:10 ERROR : a: Entry doesn't belong in directory "a" (too short) - ignoring
2023/06/03 22:58:11 ERROR : d/e: Entry doesn't belong in directory "d/e" (too short) - ignoring
2023/06/03 22:58:11 ERROR : a/c: Entry doesn't belong in directory "a/c" (too short) - ignoring
2023/06/03 22:58:11 ERROR : b: Entry doesn't belong in directory "b" (too short) - ignoring
2023/06/03 22:58:11 ERROR : a/b: Entry doesn't belong in directory "a/b" (too short) - ignoring
2023/06/03 22:58:11 ERROR : c: Entry doesn't belong in directory "c" (too short) - ignoring
2023/06/03 22:58:11 ERROR : d/e/f: Entry doesn't belong in directory "d/e/f" (too short) - ignoring
2023/06/03 22:58:11 ERROR : a/b/c: Entry doesn't belong in directory "a/b/c" (too short) - ignoring
2023/06/03 22:58:11 ERROR : c/d: Entry doesn't belong in directory "c/d" (too short) - ignoring
2023/06/03 22:58:11 ERROR : b/c: Entry doesn't belong in directory "b/c" (too short) - ignoring
2023/06/03 22:58:12 ERROR : c/d/e: Entry doesn't belong in directory "c/d/e" (too short) - ignoring
2023/06/03 22:58:12 DEBUG : GCS bucket rclone-dir-marker-test path test: Waiting for checks to finish
2023/06/03 22:58:12 DEBUG : GCS bucket rclone-dir-marker-test path test: Waiting for transfers to finish
2023/06/03 22:58:12 DEBUG : Waiting for deletions to finish
2023/06/03 22:58:12 INFO  : There was nothing to transfer
2023/06/03 22:58:12 INFO  :
Transferred:   	          0 B / 0 B, -, 0 B/s, ETA -
Checks:                 1 / 1, 100%
Elapsed time:         2.4s

2023/06/03 22:58:12 DEBUG : 6 go routines active
```

#### rclone lsd -R

Interestingly, `rclone lsd -R -vv --gcs-directory-markers gcs://rclone-dir-marker-test` doesn't produce any errors
```
$ rclone lsd -R -vv --gcs-directory-markers gcs://rclone-dir-marker-test
2023/06/03 23:03:37 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.63.0-beta.7054.51a468b2b" starting with parameters ["rclone" "lsd" "-R" "-vv" "--gcs-directory-markers" "gcs://rclone-dir-marker-test"]
2023/06/03 23:03:37 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "gcs://rclone-dir-marker-test"
2023/06/03 23:03:37 DEBUG : Using config file from "/Users/joe.cai/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2023/06/03 23:03:37 DEBUG : gcs: detected overridden config - adding "{juk_h}" suffix to name
2023/06/03 23:03:37 DEBUG : fs cache: renaming cache item "gcs://rclone-dir-marker-test" to be canonical "gcs,directory_markers='true':rclone-dir-marker-test"
           0 2000-01-01 11:00:00        -1 test
           0 2000-01-01 11:00:00        -1 test/a
           0 2000-01-01 11:00:00        -1 test/b
           0 2000-01-01 11:00:00        -1 test/b/c
           0 2000-01-01 11:00:00        -1 test/a/b
           0 2000-01-01 11:00:00        -1 test/b/c/d
           0 2000-01-01 11:00:00        -1 test/a/b/c
2023/06/03 23:03:39 DEBUG : 6 go routines active
```

However, `rclone lsd -R -vv --gcs-directory-markers gcs://rclone-dir-marker-test/test` prints the error 
```
$ rclone lsd -R -vv --gcs-directory-markers gcs://rclone-dir-marker-test/test
2023/06/03 23:03:41 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.63.0-beta.7054.51a468b2b" starting with parameters ["rclone" "lsd" "-R" "-vv" "--gcs-directory-markers" "gcs://rclone-dir-marker-test/test"]
2023/06/03 23:03:41 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "gcs://rclone-dir-marker-test/test"
2023/06/03 23:03:41 DEBUG : Using config file from "/Users/joe.cai/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2023/06/03 23:03:41 DEBUG : gcs: detected overridden config - adding "{juk_h}" suffix to name
2023/06/03 23:03:42 DEBUG : fs cache: renaming cache item "gcs://rclone-dir-marker-test/test" to be canonical "gcs,directory_markers='true':rclone-dir-marker-test/test"
2023/06/03 23:03:42 ERROR : : Entry doesn't belong in directory "" (same as directory) - ignoring
           0 2000-01-01 11:00:00        -1 a
           0 2000-01-01 11:00:00        -1 b
2023/06/03 23:03:42 ERROR : b: Entry doesn't belong in directory "b" (too short) - ignoring
           0 2000-01-01 11:00:00        -1 b/c
2023/06/03 23:03:42 ERROR : a: Entry doesn't belong in directory "a" (too short) - ignoring
           0 2000-01-01 11:00:00        -1 a/b
2023/06/03 23:03:42 ERROR : b/c: Entry doesn't belong in directory "b/c" (too short) - ignoring
           0 2000-01-01 11:00:00        -1 b/c/d
2023/06/03 23:03:42 ERROR : a/b: Entry doesn't belong in directory "a/b" (too short) - ignoring
           0 2000-01-01 11:00:00        -1 a/b/c
2023/06/03 23:03:42 ERROR : b/c/d: Entry doesn't belong in directory "b/c/d" (too short) - ignoring
2023/06/03 23:03:42 ERROR : a/b/c: Entry doesn't belong in directory "a/b/c" (too short) - ignoring
2023/06/03 23:03:42 DEBUG : 6 go routines active
```

Another interesting thing is that I'm not getting the responses from `--dump bodies` or `--dump responses`. Not sure what I'm missing.

Please let me know if you need any more information. Thanks!

> Please use this script to set up the directory markers for issue reproduction:

Thank you, that reproduces it nicely.

It looks like the non-recursive directory listing is broken which explains why some of them work and some dont

OK
    $ rclone lsf -R --gcs-directory-markers $BUCKET_URL/test -vv
Bad
    $ rclone lsf -R --gcs-directory-markers $BUCKET_URL/test -vv --disable ListR

The s3 backend and the azureblob backend also have exactly the same problem indicating this is a systematic problem from when I introduced the directory markers feature.

This is the simplest reproduction

```
$ rclone lsf --gcs-directory-markers $BUCKET_URL/test/a -vv
2023/06/09 18:42:19 ERROR : : Entry doesn't belong in directory "" (same as directory) - ignoring
```

The directory listing returned for this is

```json
{
  "kind": "storage#objects",
  "prefixes": [
    "test/a/b/"
  ],
  "items": [
    {
      "kind": "storage#object",
      "id": "rclone-dir-marker-test2/test/a//1686331810212905",
      "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/storage/v1/b/rclone-dir-marker-test2/o/test%2Fa%2F",
      "mediaLink": "https://storage.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/rclone-dir-marker-test2/o/test%2Fa%2F?generation=1686331810212905&alt=media",
      "name": "test/a/",
      "bucket": "rclone-dir-marker-test2",
      "generation": "1686331810212905",
      "metageneration": "1",
      "contentType": "application/octet-stream",
      "storageClass": "STANDARD",
      "size": "0",
      "md5Hash": "1B2M2Y8AsgTpgAmY7PhCfg==",
      "crc32c": "AAAAAA==",
      "etag": "CKnYlcTbtv8CEAE=",
      "timeCreated": "2023-06-09T17:30:10.216Z",
      "updated": "2023-06-09T17:30:10.216Z",
      "timeStorageClassUpdated": "2023-06-09T17:30:10.216Z",
      "metadata": {
        "goog-reserved-file-mtime": "1686331808",
        "mtime": "2023-06-09T18:30:08.736321733+01:00"
      }
    }
  ]
}
```

So it is the directory marker itself which is confusing rclone. I can see the problem in the code... I will try to fix in a bit - run out of time for the moment!

> Another interesting thing is that I'm not getting the responses from `--dump bodies` or `--dump responses`. Not sure what I'm missing.

You need to add `-vv`  as well to see the DEBUG logging. It is working here.

I've fixed this in gcs, azureblob and s3 - can you give this a test please?

[v1.63.0-beta.7058.0c383c0ea.fix-7038-dirmarkers](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-7038-dirmarkers/v1.63.0-beta.7058.0c383c0ea.fix-7038-dirmarkers/) on branch [fix-7038-dirmarkers](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-7038-dirmarkers) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
Thanks @ncw . I've tested it against GCS. Works like a charm!

Thanks for testing.

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.63
